fragment: Aaron Paul described his character Jesse as someone who went through hell and back multiple times and is still paying for those sins.
Jesse repays his literal debt to Ed Galbraith and sends his farewell letter of apology to Brock Cantillo.
Jesse gets revenge against Neil Kandy, a sociopathic character who is more evil than Todd.
Jesse confronts Casey, along with Neil Kandy, in a final showdown.
Walter White makes a cameo appearance in the film, with Bryan Cranston reprising his role.
Todd Alquist, portrayed by Jesse Plemons, has a sizable role in the film and is described as an odd and awful guy.
Huell Babineaux appears in a promotional campaign called 'The Countdown to El Camino' but does not appear in the film.
Jane Margolis appears in the ending of the film, delivering the final lines to Jesse.
